{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06239v1", "title": "Canonical for Automated Theorem Proving in Lean", "summary": "Canonical is a solver for type inhabitation in dependent type theory, that
is, the problem of producing a term of a given type. We present a Lean tactic
which invokes Canonical to generate proof terms and synthesize programs. The
tactic supports higher-order and dependently-typed goals, structural recursion
over indexed inductive types, and definitional equality. Canonical finds proofs
for 84% of Natural Number Game problems in 51 seconds total.", "main_category": "cs.LO", "categories": "cs.LO", "published": "2025-04-08T17:36:10Z"}
